page.title: 02Changing times
page.content: The villages of the area have undergone many changes in the last fifty or so years.The village of Stoney Stanton no longer has any quarries in use today.Many of these disused quarries are being used for infill of Leicester s waste.The modern shopping centre,small though it is,has been built on an old quarry reclaimed just over ten years ago.As has happened to much of leicestershire there was an enormous increase during the late 1960s and the 1970s in the number of houses that were built.Both Croft and Stoney Stanton have more than doubled in size thereby changing the character of these two communities.These villages serve mostly as dormitory settlements for the city of Leicester.Unfortunately the expansion of Croft quarry has lead to the destruction of old buildings.
